subject: Business
title: Network Effects Explained
description: Learn Network Effects Explained in one minute.

hook.text: The first fax machine was worthless. The second made both useful. The millionth made them essential.

buildup.text: A network effect means a product becomes more valuable as more people use it.

discovery.text: Facebook isn't great software. It's where your friends are. That's the network effect at work.

twist.text: Network effects cut both ways. Once users leave, the same force that built you tears you apart.

climax.text: MySpace had 100 million users in 2008. By 2011 everyone left for Facebook. The network unraveled.

punchline.text: The product is the people. Lose them, lose everything.

quiz.question: What is a network effect?
options: A product becomes more valuable as more people use it
A product gets cheaper to produce at scale
